hook.text: In Mexico, families build altars with food and photos to invite dead relatives back for dinner.

buildup.text: DÃ­a de los Muertos blends Aztec death rituals with Catholic All Saints' Day into a unique celebration.

discovery.text: Marigold petals are scattered from graves to homes. Their scent is believed to guide the dead back.

twist.text: It's not sad. Families laugh, sing, and eat the favorite foods of the deceased at their gravesides.

climax.text: UNESCO designated it Intangible Cultural Heritage. It's now celebrated worldwide, far beyond Mexico.

punchline.text: Mexico celebrates death with life, laughter, and marigolds.
